Major_Arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and Nan's Stubbornness
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces the setting, the main character Nan, and the initial conflict related to her reluctance to visit Ghost Town and her strained relationship with Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Scene Setting and Nan's Refusal
sub_scenes.description: The story begins by introducing Nan and her initial refusal to engage in romantic pursuits or visit the ghost town, setting up her character and the central conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction to Ghost Town and the Stubborn Woman

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Departure and Reflection
sub_scenes.description: Nan decides to go to the ghost town alone and reflects on her past feelings about it, contrasting her past enthusiasm with present weariness.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Reflections on the Ghost Town

sub_scenes.title: Modern Reality and Ghost Town's Fate
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to the modern day, revealing the impending destruction of Ghost Town for an airport and Nan's emotional reaction to this news.

narrative_arcs.title: Disbelief, Explanation, and Nan's Emotional Reaction to Ghost Town Demolition

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Reconciliation and the Snowstorm Crisis
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's reconciliation amidst the news of the ghost town's demolition, followed by a severe snowstorm that threatens their community and requires their combined efforts.

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Understanding
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile their differences, leading to a moment of understanding and affection between them.

sub_scenes.title: Nan's Despair and Arrival at Ghost Town's Demolition
sub_scenes.description: Nan arrives at the ghost town to find it being demolished, leading to her dismay and confrontation with the construction workers.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Arrival at the Transformed Ghost Town and Dismay

sub_scenes.title: Business Justification and Father-Daughter Conflict
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to Nan's father justifying the airport project as business, leading to a conflict between Nan and her father, culminating in her emotional distress.

sub_scenes.title: Parental Perspectives and Maid's Encouragement
sub_scenes.description: Nan receives contrasting perspectives from her parents and encouragement from a maid regarding Cal, influencing her to seek clarity about her feelings for Cal.

sub_scenes.title: Nan Confronts Cal and Horse Duty
sub_scenes.description: Nan seeks out Cal, leading to a confrontation about their feelings and Nan's forced duty to help with horses for the airport project.

narrative_arcs.title: Yore Dad's Deal and No Backing Down

sub_scenes.title: Nan and Cal's Confessions and Impulsive Action
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal have a heartfelt conversation where Nan confesses her feelings, followed by Nan's impulsive action with the horses and narrative reflection on loneliness.

sub_scenes.title: Snowstorm and Community Crisis
sub_scenes.description: The narrative shifts to a severe snowstorm impacting the community, leading to concern about starvation and Cal's resolve to act.

narrative_arcs.title: Accusations and Defensiveness in the Snow
Seeking Comfort and Hope Amidst the Storm

sub_scenes.title: Operation Hay Lift and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: The community receives aid through Operation Hay Lift, and Nan and Cal find romantic resolution amidst the crisis.

narrative_arcs.title: Waking Up to Snow and Hopelessness
The Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Fodder Drop
Joyful Recognition of Fodder and Cal's Foresight

Major_Arcs.title: The Legend of Chane Benson and Jeff's Obsession
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his impact on the town, focusing on Jeff's fascination with gunfighters and Clyde Surrett, leading to conflict with Sally and Jeff's disappearance.

sub_scenes.title: Chane Benson's Arrival and Town's Reaction
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's actions in town and the varied reactions of the townspeople establish his character and impact.

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Past and Gun Obsession
sub_scenes.description: Sally reflects on Jeff's past and confronts him about his growing obsession with guns and admiration for figures like Clyde Surrett.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflecting on Jeff's Brother and Past

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Fear and Clyde's Reassurance
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses her deep fears about Jeff to Clyde and seeks his help, leading to a moment of reassurance and shared resolve between Sally and Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Fear and Plea to Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Sally and Benson's Uneasy Alliance
sub_scenes.description: Sally interacts with Mr. Benson, revealing her skepticism and disapproval of his influence, particularly on young Jeff.

Major_Arcs.title: The Juniper Clarion Article and Clyde's Dilemma
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around a newspaper article in the Juniper Clarion, its impact on Clyde, his relationship with Sally, and the escalating tensions due to Benson's presence.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Fallout and Warning to Clyde
sub_scenes.description: Townspeople discuss a damaging article in the Juniper Clarion, and Clyde receives a warning about Benson and the article's potential repercussions.

narrative_arcs.title: Defense of Past Actions and Article Mention
Warning about Benson and the Article

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Fury and Benson's Justification
sub_scenes.description: Sally confronts Clyde about printing the article, expressing her fury and disbelief, while Benson explains his journalistic duty and reasons for staying in town.

sub_scenes.title: Benson's Journalistic Stance and Dinner Invitation
sub_scenes.description: Benson elaborates on his commitment to journalistic truth, and Sally extends a dinner invitation to Benson and Chane, leading to an unsettling dinner scene.

narrative_arcs.title: Article's Impact and Doubts about Clyde

sub_scenes.title: Dinner and Mistaken Identity Revelation
sub_scenes.description: The dinner scene unfolds, leading to a moonlit encounter and Sally's shocking realization of mistaken identity - that 'Jeff' is actually Chane Benson.

Major_Arcs.title: The Confrontation and Chase of Chane Benson
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the escalating confrontation after the mistaken identity reveal, leading to a physical fight, pursuit, and ultimate resolution in favor of Clyde.

sub_scenes.title: Jealousy, Fight and Sally's Warning
sub_scenes.description: Jeff's jealousy and a physical fight with Chane Benson occur, followed by Sally realizing Chane is going after Clyde and warning Jeff.

sub_scenes.title: Fair Fight Challenge and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: A challenge for a fair fight arises, leading to a tense wait and ultimately a positive resolution with Chane Benson leaving town, celebrated by Clyde and Sally.

narrative_arcs.title: Challenge for a Fair Fight and Anxious Wait
Printing the Clarion and Family Legacy

Major_Arcs.title: Steve Daley and the Approaching Range War
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc shifts focus to Steve Daley's arrival and the brewing range war, exploring his relationship with Betsy and the escalating tensions between ranchers.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Steve Daley and Initial Conflict
sub_scenes.description: A physical fight related to 'gunplay' and the introduction of Steve Daley as the new boss set the stage for conflict and authority.

narrative_arcs.title: Introduction of Steve Daley as 'The Boss'
Discussion of Betsy's Ranch and Approaching Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Clarifying Roles and Range War Concerns
sub_scenes.description: Steve Daley clarifies his role, and concerns about an impending range war and local troubles are discussed, highlighting escalating tensions.

narrative_arcs.title: Clarifying Steve Daley's Role and Concerns
Discussion of Impending Range War and Local Troubles

sub_scenes.title: Ride to Town and Hank's Orders
sub_scenes.description: Steve offers a ride to town, and Hank's obedience to 'Hank's orders' is established, indicating different power dynamics and preparations.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of a Ride and Acceptance
Hank's Orders and Waiting for Dress Material

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation in Town and Steve's Abilities
sub_scenes.description: Lady Betsy faces confrontation in town, leading to a physical fight and discussion about Steve Daley's dangerous skills.

narrative_arcs.title: Post-Purchase Conversation and Steve Daley Mention
Discussion of Steve Daley's Abilities and Impending Danger

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Ranch Philosophy and Hiring Steve
sub_scenes.description: Betsy explains her ranch philosophy and her decision to hire Steve Daley as a bodyguard despite her aversion to gunslingers.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Hire Bodyguard and Ranch Philosophy
Clarification on Firing and Stance Against Gunslingers
Gratitude, Personnel Change, and Hank Yuh's Request

sub_scenes.title: Betsy and Steve's Romantic Dilemma and Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets a condition for Steve's employment related to guns, leading to emotional pleas, confessions of love, and Steve's decision to give up his guns for Betsy.

narrative_arcs.title: Love's Proof and Surrender of Guns

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Range War and Hank's Ambush
sub_scenes.description: Ominous warnings, accusations of trespassing, and Betsy's firm stance escalate the range war, culminating in Hank's ambush and capture.

narrative_arcs.title: Declaration of War and Betsy's Authority

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Resolve and Betsy's Fear
sub_scenes.description: Betsy pleads with Steve not to go after Hank, expressing her fear, but Steve is resolute in his decision to retrieve his guns and act.

narrative_arcs.title: Aftermath and Suspense at Devil's Pass

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Confrontation and Romantic Reunion
sub_scenes.description: The narrative reaches Devil's Pass, depicting confrontation, past grievances, and ultimately, a romantic reunion between Steve and Betsy after the danger.

Major_Arcs.title: Mary, Dave, Carrie, and the Carlton Contract Drama
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on the romantic and business conflicts involving Mary, Dave, Carrie, and Fred, centered around the Carlton contract and romantic betrayals.

sub_scenes.title: Mary's Accusation and Father's Concern
sub_scenes.description: Mary confronts Dave with accusations, and then expresses concern about Curley's unusual behavior to her father.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Dispute and Unexpected Encounter
sub_scenes.description: A fence dispute arises, leading to an encounter with Fred Gordon and escalating tensions at the fence line.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Visitors and Accusation of Fence Damage

sub_scenes.title: Aftermath of Fence Dispute and Romantic Interlude
sub_scenes.description: Dave and Carrie discuss the fence encounter, transitioning from conflict resolution to a romantic interlude, interrupted by Fred's reappearance.

narrative_arcs.title: Confusion about Friendship and Second Chances
Romantic Interlude and Dismissal of Conflict

sub_scenes.title: Romantic Entanglements and Betrayal Revealed
sub_scenes.description: Conversations reveal complex romantic entanglements, leading to Carrie's realization of Fred's manipulation regarding the Carlton contract.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love for Fred Gordon
Desire to Bury the Hatchet and Romantic Overture
Flashback to Romantic Words and Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Carlton Contract Deception and Carrie's Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: Fred and Carrie discuss the Carlton contract, leading to Carrie realizing Fred's deception and confronting him and Dave at Carlton's office.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Dave and the Carlton Contract

sub_scenes.title: Resolution and Carrie's Emotional Recovery
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Carlton, declares her independence, and then finds emotional support from her father, leading to a seeming concession but unresolved feelings with Fred and Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Confrontation at Carlton's Office

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Final Words and Dave's Unspoken Feelings
sub_scenes.description: Carrie expresses her final feelings to Fred and has an encounter with Dave, leading to a confession of love for Fred and a sudden departure from Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Apology and Inquiry about Feelings for Fred
Wagon Ride and Direct Confrontation about Love

sub_scenes.title: Reunion with Fred and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Carrie falls ill, leading to a reunion with Fred, clarification about the contract, and a romantic resolution with a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: The Beef Contract Revelation and Reconciliation with Fred

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk's Wound, Escape and Ransom & Chris's Wedding
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Dirk's gunshot wound, his escape facilitated by Chris, the ensuing pursuit, and the resolution of Chris and Ransom's relationship with their wedding amidst the chaos.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Urgent Plea and Secret Meeting
sub_scenes.description: Dirk urgently seeks Carrie's help, leading to a secret meeting and revelation of his gunshot wound.

narrative_arcs.title: Dirk's Urgent Arrival and Plea for Help
The Secret Meeting and Dirk's Disguise
Dirk's Gunshot Wound and Medical Examination

sub_scenes.title: Investigation and Marshal Ransom's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: Concern about Dirk's situation leads to investigation, and Marshal Ransom arrives at the ranch, inquiring about Dirk.

narrative_arcs.title: Concern and Investigation into Dirk's Situation
Marshal Ransom's Arrival and Inquiry about Dirk
Confrontation with Rance Cready and Suspicion at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Negotiation and Confession of Love
sub_scenes.description: Marshal Ransom confronts Dirk, leading to negotiation for Dirk to stay temporarily and a nighttime conversation revealing personal history and growing affection between Chris and Ransom.

sub_scenes.title: Escape Plan and Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: Chris and Ransom's relationship deepens with confessions of love, leading to Chris proposing an escape plan for Dirk, which she ultimately uses to deceive Ransom and facilitate Dirk's escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Escape Plan Proposal and Seeming Agreement

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and Gunfight at Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: The escape plan turns into a chase, culminating in a gunfight at Devil's Pass, resulting in Chris's injury and a moral dilemma.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Escape and Chris's Return
sub_scenes.description: Dirk escapes, while Chris, after initially going along with the escape, decides to return to Ransom, confessing her love and revealing her betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Ransom's Recovery and Wedding Day
sub_scenes.description: Ransom recovers, leading to a romantic reunion with Chris, a marriage proposal, and the wedding day preparations, interrupted by Dirk's unexpected arrival.
